dr.app.beagle.evomodel.substmodel
Class UniformizedSubstitutionModel

java.lang.Object
  dr.inference.model.AbstractModel
      dr.app.beagle.evomodel.substmodel.MarkovJumpsSubstitutionModel
          dr.app.beagle.evomodel.substmodel.UniformizedSubstitutionModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Model, ModelListener, StatisticList, VariableListener, MPISerializable, Identifiable, java.io.Serializable
public class UniformizedSubstitutionModel
extends MarkovJumpsSubstitutionModel

A class extension for implementing Markov chain-induced counting processes (markovjumps) via uniformization in BEAST using BEAGLE

This work is supported by NSF grant 0856099

Minin VN and Suchard MA (2008) Counting labeled transitions in continuous-time Markov models of evolution. Journal of Mathematical Biology, 56, 391-412.

Rodrigue N, Philippe H and Lartillot N (2006) Uniformization for sampling realizations of Markov processes: applications to Bayesian implementations of codon substitution models. Bioinformatics, 24, 56-62.

Hobolth A and Stone E (2009) Simulation from endpoint-conditioned, continuous-time Markov chains on a finite state space, with applications to molecular evolution. Annals of Applied Statistics, 3, 1204-1231.

Author:
Marc Suchard, Vladimir Minin
See Also:
Serialized Form

storeState

protected void storeState()
Description copied from class: AbstractModel
Additional state information, outside of the sub-model is stored by this call.

Overrides:
storeState in class MarkovJumpsSubstitutionModel

restoreState

protected void restoreState()
Description copied from class: AbstractModel
After this call the model is guaranteed to have returned its extra state information to the values coinciding with the last storeState call. Sub-models are handled automatically and do not need to be considered in this method.

Overrides:
restoreState in class MarkovJumpsSubstitutionModel
